tasks.title: Move Graph Package into streamweave Package
tasks.description: Move the streamweave-graph package into the core streamweave package as a module. This consolidates graph functionality into the core package where it will be used universally.
tasks.details: The graph package currently exists as a separate package. We need to move it into streamweave/src/graph/ and update all imports. This is the foundation for integrating graph functionality into the core package.

subtasks.title: Create graph module directory structure
subtasks.description: Create packages/streamweave/src/graph/ directory and packages/streamweave/src/graph/nodes/ subdirectory. Set up the basic module structure.

subtasks.title: Copy core graph modules into streamweave
subtasks.description: Copy core graph modules (graph.rs, execution.rs, connection.rs, channels.rs, traits.rs, etc.) from packages/graph/src/ to packages/streamweave/src/graph/. Update module path references and imports.

subtasks.title: Move all node types to graph/nodes/
subtasks.description: Move node.rs and all control flow nodes (from control_flow/) to packages/streamweave/src/graph/nodes/. Create nodes/mod.rs to export all node types. Move router nodes (broadcast_router, key_based_router, merge_router, round_robin_router) to nodes/ as well.

subtasks.title: Move supporting modules to graph/
subtasks.description: Move supporting modules (batching.rs, compression.rs, serialization.rs, shared_memory_channel.rs, stateful.rs, subgraph.rs, throughput.rs, windowing.rs, zero_copy.rs) to packages/streamweave/src/graph/. Update all internal imports.

subtasks.title: Update streamweave lib.rs to export graph module
subtasks.description: Add 'pub mod graph;' to packages/streamweave/src/lib.rs. Create graph/mod.rs that exports all graph functionality. Ensure Graph, GraphBuilder, and all node types are accessible.

subtasks.title: Update streamweave Cargo.toml dependencies
subtasks.description: Add all dependencies from graph package to streamweave Cargo.toml. Check for tokio, async-stream, serde, tracing, and any other graph-specific dependencies. Remove graph package from workspace if it exists.

subtasks.title: Update all graph module imports
subtasks.description: Update all imports throughout the codebase that reference streamweave_graph to use streamweave::graph instead. Update examples, tests, and any other code that uses graph functionality.

subtasks.title: Verify graph module compiles in streamweave
subtasks.description: Run 'cargo check' on streamweave package to ensure graph module compiles correctly. Fix any import, dependency, or module path issues.

tasks.title: Refactor Graph to Use Message<T>
tasks.description: Refactor the entire graph system to work with Message<T> as the universal type. This ensures all data flowing through the graph is wrapped in messages, providing consistent metadata and ID tracking.
tasks.details: The graph system currently works with raw types (T). We need to update it to work with Message<T> internally, ensuring all channels, nodes, and connections handle messages. This affects channels, node execution, serialization, and all graph operations.

subtasks.title: Update ChannelItem to use Message<T>
subtasks.description: Modify ChannelItem enum and channel types to work with Message<T> instead of raw types. Update TypeErasedSender and TypeErasedReceiver to handle Message<T>. Ensure serialization works with messages.

subtasks.title: Update Node types to work with Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update ProducerNode, TransformerNode, and ConsumerNode to work with Message<T>. Modify node execution logic to handle Message streams. Update port type extraction to work with Message-wrapped types.

subtasks.title: Update Graph execution to use Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update Graph execution engine to ensure all data flowing through connections is Message<T>. Modify spawn_node_task and execution logic to handle Message streams. Update channel creation to use Message types.

subtasks.title: Update connection validation for Message types
subtasks.description: Update CompatibleWith trait and connection validation to work with Message<T> types. Ensure type compatibility checks work correctly with Message-wrapped types. Update port type extraction.

subtasks.title: Update control flow nodes for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update all control flow nodes (aggregate, delay, error_branch, for_each, group_by, if_router, join, match_router, synchronize, timeout, while_loop) to work with Message<T>. Ensure they preserve message IDs and metadata.

subtasks.title: Update router nodes for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update all router nodes (broadcast_router, key_based_router, merge_router, round_robin_router) to work with Message<T>. Ensure routing logic preserves message metadata and IDs when distributing messages.

subtasks.title: Update serialization for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update serialization module to handle Message<T> serialization. Ensure message IDs and metadata are preserved during serialization/deserialization. Update compression to work with messages.

subtasks.title: Update zero-copy and shared memory for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update zero-copy channel and shared memory channel implementations to work with Message<T>. Ensure zero-copy optimizations work correctly with message types. Update ArcPool and related types.

subtasks.title: Update stateful and windowing for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update stateful node support and windowing functionality to work with Message<T>. Ensure state management and windowing operations preserve message metadata. Update checkpointing for messages.

subtasks.title: Update subgraph support for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update subgraph functionality to work with Message<T>. Ensure messages flow correctly through subgraph boundaries. Update subgraph node execution to handle Message streams.

subtasks.title: Update error handling in graph for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update graph error handling to work with Message<T>. Ensure error contexts include message information. Update error propagation through graph connections to preserve message metadata.

subtasks.title: Verify graph compiles with Message<T>
subtasks.description: Run 'cargo check' on streamweave package to ensure all graph functionality compiles correctly with Message<T>. Fix any type errors, import issues, or compilation problems.

tasks.title: Update Tests and Examples for Graph Integration
tasks.description: Update all tests and examples to work with the integrated graph module and Message<T> types. Ensure all graph functionality is properly tested.
tasks.details: All existing graph tests need to be moved and updated to work with the new module structure and Message<T> types. Examples need to be updated to demonstrate the integrated graph API.

subtasks.title: Move graph tests to streamweave package
subtasks.description: Move all tests from packages/graph/ to packages/streamweave/tests/graph/. Update test imports to use streamweave::graph. Organize tests by module (nodes, execution, channels, etc.).

subtasks.title: Update graph tests for Message<T>
subtasks.description: Update all graph tests to work with Message<T> types. Update test data creation to use wrap_message(). Verify message IDs and metadata are preserved in tests. Update assertions to check message properties.

subtasks.title: Test node execution with Message<T>
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive tests for node execution with Message<T>. Test ProducerNode, TransformerNode, and ConsumerNode with messages. Verify message flow, ID preservation, and metadata handling.

subtasks.title: Test graph execution with Message<T>
subtasks.description: Create integration tests for full graph execution with Message<T>. Test multi-node graphs, verify message flow through connections, and ensure metadata is preserved throughout the graph.

subtasks.title: Test control flow nodes with Message<T>
subtasks.description: Test all control flow nodes (aggregate, delay, if_router, join, etc.) with Message<T>. Verify they correctly handle messages, preserve IDs and metadata, and route messages appropriately.

subtasks.title: Update graph examples
subtasks.description: Update all graph examples in examples/ directory to use streamweave::graph and Message<T>. Update example code to demonstrate message-based graph usage. Ensure examples compile and run correctly.

subtasks.title: Run all tests and fix breakages
subtasks.description: Run all tests in the streamweave package. Fix any test breakages caused by the graph integration and Message<T> refactoring. Ensure all tests pass before considering the integration complete.

tasks.title: Update Documentation for Graph Integration
tasks.description: Update all documentation to reflect the integrated graph module and Message<T> usage. Ensure users understand how to use the graph API with messages.
tasks.details: Documentation needs to be updated to explain the integrated graph API, how to use it with Message<T>, and how graph nodes work with messages. Include examples and migration guidance.

subtasks.title: Update streamweave README with graph documentation
subtasks.description: Add graph section to packages/streamweave/README.md explaining the integrated graph API. Document how to create graphs, add nodes, connect nodes, and execute graphs with Message<T>.

subtasks.title: Update graph module rustdoc
subtasks.description: Update all rustdoc comments in graph module to explain Message<T> usage. Add examples showing graph creation, node usage, and message handling. Document all public APIs.

subtasks.title: Create graph nodes documentation
subtasks.description: Add comprehensive documentation to graph/nodes/ module explaining all node types, how they work with Message<T>, and usage examples. Document ProducerNode, TransformerNode, ConsumerNode, and all control flow nodes.

subtasks.title: Update graph examples in documentation
subtasks.description: Update all example code in documentation to use streamweave::graph and Message<T>. Show both simple and complex graph examples. Ensure all examples compile and demonstrate best practices.

subtasks.title: Create graph migration guide
subtasks.description: Create a migration guide explaining how to update code from streamweave-graph package to streamweave::graph. Include examples of API changes and Message<T> usage patterns.
